intro: Huberia insignis, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Huberia insignis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
